instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2784: What is 820-2784? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac A1311 don't power on
threads.message:
Hi,
I have Apple iMac A1311  K74 MLB  051-8337 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> for repair with no power.
After i plug in PSU i get LED1 green for 1 second and thats all.
I checked <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_12VE_EN1</SIGNAL> is 3,8V
I soldered new <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> without any success, still no P3V3S5.
I have only 12Volst on board.

Could You help me with this problem, maybe i looking for problem in bad place. 
This is my first iMac board for repair.

Kindly regards Mariusz

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac A1311 don't power on
threads.message: First measure more power rails and report them all here see if one is missing or of on the volts it Should be

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac A1311 don't power on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 4.99
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> 0 (only 3.3V after plug in for 1sec)
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5_FET</SIGNAL> 12V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.41V
<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL> 12V

What else i could measure?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac A1311 don't power on
threads.message: Probably a short on one of the S3 or S0 rails. Measure all voltage rails for shorts.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac A1311 don't power on
threads.message:
You were right, it was      [FONT=Courier]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3_USB_HUB</SIGNAL> [/FONT]line

When I put 3.3V at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> line nothing was heating but after 1 minute short disappeared and i find this place.
Thanks for the answers.
Mariusz

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac A1311 don't power on
threads.message: So this one is solved now?
